channel.title: Problem running server
channel.description: When I click runserver.bat this pop-up comes up and it goes away to quick for me to catch the words, but it says 'Java' not javac is not recognized as an external or operable program or batch file I am completely clueless as to this because at first it was saying Javac is not recognized.... but now this I am so confused anyone who ran into this problem and fixed can you please help. :confused:

@xxDiluted2xx wrote:

No problem. Good luck in the future. (:

item.title: Problem running server
item.dc:creator: @xxDiluted2xx xxDiluted2xx
item.description:
@xxDiluted2xx wrote:

Okay, since it’s from your computer, make sure your ip duc is set. But you CANNOT get on from the ip. Basicly, if it’s a normal 317, try using silab or a client. (Ip changable) But change the ip to 127.0.0.1 - So you can connect to your server. Like I said, you cannot get on from the ip set in your duc.

Read full topic

@xxDiluted2xx wrote:

iaboni:

Thank you diluted for all this help but still this message comes up, any other ideas??

Tried setting your variables? There is a section on it in ‘How to start a server’ in the help section I think. And no problem. It’s my free time. So I try to do as much as I can. (:

item.title: Problem running server
item.dc:creator: @xxDiluted2xx xxDiluted2xx
item.description:
@xxDiluted2xx wrote:

[quote=“iaboni, post:6, topic:285983”]Well this is the coding I am using and my JDK is 1.6.1.0_14

[code]@echo off
color 9
java -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server

pause[/code][/quote]

Replace it with this, tell me what happens.

@echo off
java -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.14-ga-bin.jar server
pause

Read full topic

item.title: Problem running server
item.dc:creator: @iaboni iaboni
item.description:
@iaboni wrote:

Well this is the coding I am using and my JDK is 1.6.1.0_14 and all my variables are there so I really don’t know and if the other guys idea works this is my school laptop and last time i deleted all my java the whole computer crashed so I dont know what to do. You could say I am in a pridicament.

[code]@echo off
color 9
java -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server

pause[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Problem running server
item.dc:creator: @xxDiluted2xx xxDiluted2xx
item.description:
@xxDiluted2xx wrote:

Make sure your jdk is saved into a folder called ‘Java’ in your program files folder. And set it to the version that your version of JDK or JRE that you have. If it’s not 508, then make sure you’ve set your variables and boundaries. It’s not hard. There is a little application that someone made, I think it’s in the download’s section. Pinned if I’m not mistaken. Try that. It should work. I had the same problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem running server
item.dc:creator: @h4x0r88 h4x0r88
item.description:
@h4x0r88 wrote:

you need to clear ALL the java off your system and reinstall all of it back on because your system 32 cant find your java!

Read full topic
